benchmark_details.name: T2VSafetyBench
benchmark_details.overview: T2VSafetyBench is a new benchmark designed for conducting safety-critical assessments of text-to-video models, addressing 12 critical aspects of video generation safety.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and improve the safety of text-to-video generative models by assessing their risk across multiple safety dimensions.

data.source: Malicious text prompt dataset constructed from real-world prompts, generated prompts by GPT-4, and jailbreaking attack-based prompts.
data.annotation: Prompts curated and fine-tuned based on definitions of safety aspects.

methodology.calculation: Correlation between GPT-4 assessments and human reviews is calculated to establish evaluation reliability.
methodology.interpretation: A higher correlation coefficient indicates better alignment between automated and human assessments.
methodology.validation: The evaluation is validated through manual assessments by volunteers.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Informed consent was obtained from volunteers for human evaluations.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Volunteers were informed about the potential exposure to distressing content.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study received exempt approval from the Institutional Review Board (IRB).
